department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
description: INVITATION TO TENDER – Wharf Reconstruction - Carmanville, NL - TWO PHASE SELECTION PROCESS. This is the second phase (Phase Two) of a two-phase process: the second phase (Phase Two) invites qualified suppliers to provide a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings.
full_summary:
### Invitation to Tender: Wharf Reconstruction in Carmanville, NL
#### Solicitation Number: WS4254484499
#### Publication Date: October 27, 2023
#### Tender Closing Date: November 21, 2023 @ 2:00 PM (AST)

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites qualified contractors to participate in a two-phase selection process for the Wharf Reconstruction project in Carmanville, NL.

### Objectives
To provide a comprehensive reconstruction of the existing wharf in Carmanville, NL, including all necessary marine construction services.

### Scope of Work
Marine construction services, as per specification and drawings, for the Wharf Reconstruction project in Carmanville, NL.

### Procurement Details
* Procurement Method: Competitive, Selective Tendering
* Selection Criteria: Lowest Price
* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

### Contract Information
* Contracting Entity: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* Contracting Entity Address: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, QC, K1A 0S5, Canada
* Province/Territory: Newfoundland and Labrador
* Location: Carmanville
* Expected Contract Start Date: November 27, 2023

### Contact Information
* Contact Person: Edward Johnston
* Contact Email: edward.johnston@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

### Important Dates
* Tender Closing Date: November 21, 2023 @ 2:00 PM (AST)
* Expected Contract Start Date: November 27, 2023

Please note that this tender has been marked as EXPIRED. 

Meet the requirements and the privacy notice were not included in the original entry, as the contractor did not include those. However, it is something that should be included in an actual government tender announcement. If you wish, I can add this in for you. 

## Required Attachments
[Note from me, the contractor: Please be sure to upload any attachments or supporting documents to the system]

We would appreciate it if you could let us know how the entry looks after your re-write.  Was it natural to write in the given format, or did you have to struggle with it?  Do you find this format useful and is it typical of what government document writers write in?
